speaker: LAUREN
line: That’s a little hard to believe.

speaker: INCANTO
line: Just from your words – the way you saw things – I knew I wanted to meet you.

speaker: LAUREN
line: Well, I hope you’re not too disappointed.

speaker: INCANTO
line: Lauren, we have a real connection which is rare.

speaker: LAUREN
line: Most men don’t feel that way.

speaker: INCANTO
line: Most men don’t know what they’re missing. What?

speaker: LAUREN
line: I can’t believe this. I mean, I can’t believe that after three months we finally meet in person, and you’re … I don’t know. I just really enjoyed myself tonight.

speaker: LAUREN
line: Oh, no. Oh …

speaker: INCANTO
line: Here. Let me help you.

speaker: LAUREN
line: My sister gave it to me. For good luck, I guess. Kind of dopey, huh? I mean a clover leaf. How blatant can you get?

speaker: INCANTO
line: It’s beautiful.

speaker: LAUREN
line: Thank you.

speaker: COP
line: Cock-a-doodle-doo. Rise and shine in there.

speaker: COP
line: Mother of God.

speaker: COP
line: Dispatch, this is Car 73. I’ve got a ? … out on the lake front at Gary and Campbell …

speaker: CROSS
line: Driver’s license. Lauren MacKalvey? Okay, I saw that. I want you to get on it.

speaker: CROSS
line: Agent Mulder? Alan Cross, Cleveland PD. Thanks a lot for coming out so quickly.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is my partner, Dana Scully.

speaker: CROSS
line: We found a purse in the front seat of that car. According to the license, her name is Lauren MacKalvey but we’re not sure yet that this is her body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’re not sure?

speaker: CROSS
line: We couldn’t make a positive ID, considering. Wendy Sparks – she’s our Bureau liaison --- she thought this would be closer to your area of expertise.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Any indication what would have been the cause of death?

speaker: CROSS
line: We were just lucky to get her into the bag without her body falling apart.

speaker: MULDER
line: This substance --- Did you find it anywhere else in the car? On the carpet or the upholstery?

speaker: CROSS
line: As a matter of fact, no.

speaker: MULDER
line: So it was only on the victim’s body?

speaker: CROSS
line: That’s what it looks like.

speaker: CROSS
line: Why? You have an idea what happened here?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Not yet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We’ll call you when we find anything else concrete.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Detective?

speaker: CROSS
line: Yeah. Sure. Call me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what do you think it is?

speaker: MULDER
line: A couple of months ago a case came across my desk from the Mississippi office. Four women from Aberdeen had disappeared in less than a month.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Disappeared?

speaker: MULDER
line: Only one of the victims was found, but her body was too decomposed to perform a viable autopsy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what we just saw was not decomposition.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know. That’s why I want you to find out what this is while you’re at the coroner’s office.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What about you? Where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m going to try to find out if Lauren MacKelvey was a Lonely Heart. Each of the Aberdeen victims had answered personal ads in the local papers. If this is the same killer, he’s just getting started.

speaker: HUGGS
line: I’M NOT SURE IT’S SUCH A GOOD IDEA FOR US TO MEET.

speaker: TIMID
line: WHY. WHAT ARE YOU AFRAID OF?

speaker: HUGGS
line: DISAPPOINTMENT. REJECTION. THE USUAL ROUND OF SUSPECTS.

speaker: TIMID
line: BELIEVE ME, I KNOW. I’VE BEEN DOWN THAT ROAD ONCE OR TWICE. BUT YOU CAN’T HIDE BEHIND YOUR COMPUTER FOREVER.

speaker: TIMID
line: CAN YOU?

speaker: INCANTO
line: Yes. What is it?

speaker: LANDLADY
line: The handyman replaced the locks on the storage closets and I wanted to bring by your new key. I know what you do, Mr. Incanto.

speaker: INCANTO
line: What is it you think that I do?

speaker: LANDLADY
line: With all your typing and those packages from publishers in New York – you’re a novelist, right? Or an editor? You see, I’m a writer, too.

speaker: INCANTO
line: What a coincidence. Shouldn’t you be off writing, or something?

speaker: LANDLADY
line: I don’t mean to impose or anything, but would you mind reading something of mine? It won’t take much time. They’re poems.

speaker: INCANTO
line: Certainly. Good-bye.

speaker: CROSS
line: Oh, it’s you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s not a problem, is it?

speaker: CROSS
line: No. Just that Dr. Kramer didn’t tell me that you were observing the autopsy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m not observing. I’m performing it myself.

speaker: CROSS
line: You’re a medical doctor?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You sound surprised.

speaker: CROSS
line: I don’t know. I, uh, I guess maybe I am.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why?

speaker: CROSS
line: It’s nothing personal, Agent Scully. I’m just old-fashioned in certain regards.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Old-fashioned?

speaker: CROSS
line: The truth is, I question the wisdom of assigning female law enforcement officers to certain types of cases.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Like this one?

speaker: CROSS
line: Whoever killed Lauren MacKalvey has a definite attitude toward women. So this has to be affecting your judgement.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I appreciate your concern, Detective, but it’s not necessary. All I want to do is solve this case just like you.

speaker: CROSS
line: Look, I’m not being sexist here. I’m just being honest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where would you like the autopsy report sent?

speaker: CROSS
line: You can fax it to my office.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The date is august 29th. The time is 4:15 pm. The subject’s name is Lauren MacKalvey. Caucasian. Female. Approximate time of death uncertain. Cause of death unknown.

speaker: ROOMMATE
line: It just doesn’t make sense. He seemed so nice.

speaker: MULDER
line: I thought you said you never met the man Lauren was with last night.

speaker: ROOMMATE
line: I never did. He just seemed nice on the computer.

speaker: MULDER
line: They met through an online service?

speaker: ROOMMATE
line: In one of those chat rooms. You know, here people get together to talk about whatever they’re into.

speaker: MULDER
line: Right. Do you remember what room Lauren was in when she met him?

speaker: ROOMMATE
line: Big and Beautiful. She had kind of a weight problem. But "2 Shy" didn’t seem to care. It wasn’t about sex with him.

speaker: MULDER
line: "Too Shy?"

speaker: ROOMMATE
line: That was his online name. Lauren used to … read me his letters. They were amazing. He knew exactly what to say. He sure as hell fooled me.

line: She read you his letters? Do you think that she kept any hard copies of them?

speaker: ROOMMATE
line: Actually, I saved them myself. If you want, I can get them for you.

speaker: ROOMMATE
line: Yeah. It’s right over there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Listen, Scully. Our killer may have moved out of the personal columns and onto the internet. I’m gonna send out a localized online warning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you know it’s the same guy?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because he opened the account with one of the Aberdeen victim’s credit cards. I just called the online service.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I’d like you to meet me at the coroner’s office as soon as you can.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you find anything in the autopsy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There’s not going to be an autopsy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s a metacarpal from Lauren MacKalvey’s hand. In life, bones have the tensile strength of forged iron. Even in death, they remain strong. But look at this.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did this turn out to be?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s organic. Mostly hydrochloric acid similar to what is secreted by the gastric mugosa.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s similar to stomach acid?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Almost identical only twice as acidic. I also found trace amounts of pepsin which is a digestive enzyme.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you’re saying that this did that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t know how else to explain such accelerated autolysis.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s in here, Scully? Theoretically it should contain the same cellular components as her various tissues—skin, muscle, blood …

speaker: SCULLY
line: In some broken-down form, yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: In the results of your chemical analysis did you find anything missing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Missing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t think so. All the body tissues were accounted for …. except there were extremely low almost trace amounts of adipose.

speaker: MULDER
line: Fatty tissue. That could explain the weight discrepancy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What weight discrepancy?

speaker: MULDER
line: The ME recorded Lauren’s weight at 122 but her driver’s license had her at 165.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She probably lost weight since the license was issued.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, actually Lauren’s roommate said she was quite nervous about meeting this guy because she put on some weight recently.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What possible motivation could the killer have for removing his victim’s fatty tissue? I mean, who do you think we’re dealing with here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know.

speaker: ELLEN
line: God. I look awful. Please tell me it’s the mirror. an on-line warning by the FBI aimed specifically at women in Cleveland.

speaker: ELLEN
line: Give me some credit, will you, Jo? I happen to be a pretty good judge of character.

speaker: ELLEN
line: No? You’re doing a pretty good job of it.

speaker: ELLEN
line: Do you think this is easy for me? I finally connect with someone I like who seems to like me. I’m scared enough to meet him for the first time without you telling me he’s Charles Manson.

speaker: ELLEN
line: Besides, it’s not like he’s some stranger. I’ve been chatting with him everyday for over a month. But what if he isn’t?

line: I got what you need over here. Ooh, yeah. Uh-huh. See something you like? Come on, do you want some? I think he has the hots for you, baby. I think so. You know you want it. Mm-hmm.

line: Uh-uh. No kissing. Anything else you want is fine, but no kissing. What are you doing?

line: Her name was Holly McClain. She’s worked in this area for a couple of years now, but she wasn’t most john’s first pick, if you know what I mean.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened?

speaker: CROSS
line: It looks like our guy again. One of the other girls found her last night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All of the air passages are blocked with what appears to be the same viscous hydrochloric acid we found on Lauren MacKalvey.

speaker: CROSS
line: Do you know what this stuff is?

speaker: CROSS
line: Hey, this is still my case.

speaker: MULDER
line: We’re dealing with a serial murderer who’s using an online service to attract his victims – all single women looking for Mr. Right.

line: That doesn’t jibe with a $20 hooker.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, it doesn’t. Something must have gone wrong last night. He was forced to improvise.

speaker: CROSS
line: We’re still talking about a guy without a consistent MO.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not necessarily. These are letters he e-mailed to Lauren MacKalvey. They contain lines from a handful 16th century Italian poems.

line: So he has a copy of Barlett’s Quotations. So what?

line: You won’t find any of these in Bartlett’s.

line: I’m not sure I follow you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at this. Guinezelle’s "Lavitanova," Casteona’s "Il Courtagiano," and others I won’t even try to pronounce. These are from obscure texts from privately owned libraries that only lend to academic affiliates.

speaker: CROSS
line: You’re saying our … our suspect’s a college professor?

speaker: MULDER
line: Or a graduate student, a visiting Fellow, maybe a translator. What we need is to compile a list of everybody in Cleveland who has these credentials. Can you do that?

line: Here’s something else that might help. The killer should have an identifiable wound pattern from this.

line: Leave it.

line: Hello, Mr. Incanto.

line: Good afternoon, Jesse.

speaker: LANDLADY
line: Jesse did you find those drop cloths yet? Mr. Incanto, I didn’t know you were out here.

speaker: INCANTO
line: I’m just picking up a package.

line: Jesse, did you know that Mr. Incanto’s a writer?

line: I know, Mom. You told me a thousand times.

speaker: LANDLADY
line: I’m putting those poems together. If you don’t mind, I’d like to drop them by sometime.

speaker: INCANTO

speaker: JESSE
line: Give me a break.

speaker: INCANTO
line: Actually, I’m busy. I have a deadline.

speaker: LANDLADY
line: I wish you weren’t always so rude to him.

speaker: JESSE
line: I don’t care. He creeps me out. Plus he smells gross --- like he uses dish soap for aftershave.

speaker: CROSS
line: Okay. Lane just gave me the list from the University. How’s it going over here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good. We are expanding the search to include the faculty rosters from the local community colleges. We …. oh …. Excuse me.

speaker: CROSS
line: Sure. I’ll let you know what we turn up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you find anything?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m almost done with the list.

speaker: MULDER
line: That skin you found under the prostitute’s fingernails -- I had the crime lab check the DNA results against the known offenders database.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And? Well, it says here they didn’t find a match.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, but they did find something else. Check the next page where I’ve circled.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "The second sample contains no oils or essential fatty acid." Well, Mulder, there are any number of factors which could have caused that result. Where are you going with this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, it’s not yet the finely detailed insanity that you’ve come to expect from me. It’s just a theory, but what if he’s not doing this out of a psychotic impulse but rather out of physical hunger? Maybe he needs to replenish this chemical deficiency in order to survive

speaker: SCULLY
line: From a dry skin sample you’re concluding what? That he’s some kind of fat-sucking vampire?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know how else to explain MacKalvey’s missing adipose. And I bet if you checked the Aberdeen victims you’d find exactly the same thing. This killer secretes a digestive substance which renders the victims fat…

speaker: SCULLY
line: ….which he ingests before the rest of the body dissolves entirely.

speaker: MULDER
line: There are examples of this in nature, aren’t there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, scorpions predigest their food outside of their body by regurgitating onto their prey but I don’t know too many scorpions who surf the internet.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, but if I’m right, we’re not just looking for a serial murderer. We’re looking for some kind of genetically different human being – a creature who may be responsible for who knows how many missing person cases throughout the United States.

speaker: CROSS
line: I’ve combed every faculty list and academic journal in Cleveland. Came up with 38 names. I figured we’d divy up the list and I’d get the Captain to put some more people on it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’d like to brief them, if that’s okay with you.

speaker: CROSS
line: Sure.

speaker: COMPUTER
line: You have mail.

speaker: HUGGS
line: I’M SO SORRY. CAN WE PLEASE TRY AGAIN? I’LL EXPLAIN WHEN I SEE YOU. I PROMISE NOT TO FLAKE OUT. APOLOGETICALLY YOURS, ELLEN.

line: Mr. Brenman? I’m Special Agent Scully from the FBI. Would you mind if I asked you some questions? Thanks.

speaker: INCANTO
line: Sure.

speaker: SCULLY
line: These are all University addresses. Chances are, he spent most of the morning on campus. MULDER comes over to SCULLY.)

line: I’m treating you.

line: You know, I still feel so stupid about the other night.

speaker: INCANTO
line: Ellen, you don’t have to make any excuses. Whatever reasons you had, I’m sure they were good ones.

line: You were right though --- About me being afraid? It’s a pretty hard habit to break.

speaker: INCANTO
line: You’re not still afraid, are you?

speaker: ELLEN
line: No, I’m not.

line: Good. Unfortunately, I have to get going. The last crosstown bus leaves in 15 minutes.

speaker: ELLEN
line: You’re taking the bus home?

speaker: INCANTO
line: My car’s in the shop … but I’ll call you.

line: Don’t be silly. I’ll drive you.

line: Ellen, you don’t have to do that.

speaker: ELLEN
line: I’m driving you home.

speaker: LANDLADY
line: Mr. Incanto?

line: You know, I only live a few blocks away --- near St. Mark’s --- until some developer decided to turn it into condos. You can still see the steeple.

line: Ellen, you don’t have to be nervous.

line: He’s a police detective . His name’s Cross.. That’s right. He would have been by sometime this afternoon.

line: I smelled her perfume.

line: That’s when I knew he was lying. She was wearing her perfume when she left for her class.

line: I was scared that he’d hurt me. I could tell he wanted to when he grabbed me.

line: Okay, Jesse. That helps us. I’m going to take a couple of minutes and go talk to Agent Mulder. Mrs. Sheperd is right here. I’ll be right back.

line: Composite artist came up with this sketch from a neighbor’s description. His name is Virgil Incanto. At least that’s what it says on his rental agreement. There’s no record that the guy even exists – no DMV, no birth certificate, no Social Security, not even a bank account.

line: What about employment records?

line: He’s a translator of Italian literature. Freelance, but his publisher pays him in cashier’s checks

line: You were right, Mulder. They’re coming up empty at the airport. So I’m releasing the sketch to the media. We still have time to make the morning papers.

line: "Friend?"

line: That was Lauren MacKalvey’s online name. These are all his victims. A regular grocery list.

line: Done.

line: I’m going to call the online service and have them fax us the telephone numbers of all those women.

line: The machine will pick up. Milk? I only have nonfat.

line: No, no, no. This is fine.

speaker: ELLEN
line: Give me a minute, will you? I’d like to put on some clothes.

speaker: INCANTO
line: Ellen, you don’t have to do that.

speaker: ELLEN
line: I want to. I’ll be right back.

speaker: ELLEN
line: YOU WON’T BELIEVE WHO’S HERE RIGHT NOW, I DON’T KNOW…

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just lock your doors until we contact you again. You’ll be fine, Miss Iniss. He doesn’t tend towards forcible entry.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, thanks. That was Cleveland TV. They’ve already reported three of the women on the list as missing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we’ve already contacted everyone on this list directly except for these two. I left messages on their machines.

speaker: MULDER
line: We better go check on them anyway.

speaker: ELLEN
line: YOU WON’T BELIEVE WHO’S HERE RIGHT NOW, I DON’T KNOW IF I SHOULD TELL YOU OR NOT. I HAVE TO GO. DETAILS IN THE MORNING. ELLEN

speaker: COMPUTER
line: You have mail.

speaker: MESSAGE
line: THIS MAN IS WANTED BY THE FBI AND SHOULD BE CONSIDERED EXTREMELY DANGEROUS. IF YOU HAVE ANY INFORMATION, IMMEDIATELY CONTACT 800-555-0132.

speaker: INCANTO
line: Ellen? I hope you’re not online with some other guy.

speaker: ELLEN
line: I was just e-mailing my girlfriend.

speaker: INCANTO
line: Your girlfriend?

speaker: ELLEN
line: Yes.

speaker: INCANTO
line: What about?

speaker: ELLEN
line: Us.

speaker: INCANTO
line: What were you telling her?

speaker: ELLEN
line: Just how happy I am, that you’re still interested in me. And that you hadn’t rejected me like I thought you had.

speaker: INCANTO
line: I’m glad you feel that way, Ellen. I know I do.

speaker: ELLEN
line: Look, I still haven’t changed my clothes. Why don’t you go wait outside, and I’ll be right out.

speaker: INCANTO
line: You look beautiful. You don’t need to change for me .

speaker: ELLEN
line: Please …. leave me alone, please! What do you want?

speaker: MULDER
line: We’re with the FBI. We’re looking for Ellen Kaminsky. Why? What’s wrong? Is something the matter?

speaker: MULDER
line: Get back in.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ellen?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder ….

speaker: SCULLY
line: You go ahead. I’ll stay here. Go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is Federal Agent Dana Scully. I need an ambulance right away to 658 South Hudson Avenue, Apartment number 23. Request special chemical burn unit.

speaker: MULDER
line: Freeze! Federal Agent! Now put your hands up and step out where I can see you.

speaker: YOUNG BLACK MAN
line: Just … just don’t shoot me, man.

speaker: MULDER
line: Jennifer Flackett. Kathy Miller. Hillary Turk. 47 women reported missing in five states. At least give their families some peace of mind and tell us how many are on that list because of you.

speaker: INCANTO
line: They’re all mine.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, Scully. Open the door.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why?

speaker: INCANTO
line: When you look at me, you see a monster … But I was just feeding the hunger.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’re more than a monster. You didn’t just feed on their bodies. You fed on their minds.

speaker: INCANTO
line: My weakness was no greater than theirs. I gave them what they wanted. They gave me what I needed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not anymore.

speaker: INCANTO
line: "The dead are no longer lonely."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let me out.
